00043 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00044 #include <obd_class.h>
00045 #include <obd_support.h>
00046 #include <obd.h>

00048 #include <lustre_dlm.h>
00049 #include <lustre_mdc.h>
00050 #include <linux/pagemap.h>

00053 #include "cl_object.h"
00054 #include "llite_internal.h"

00056 
00057 static const struct cl_lock_descr whole_file = {
00058         .cld_start = 0,
00059         .cld_end   = CL_PAGE_EOF,
00060         .cld_mode  = CLM_READ
00061 };
00062 
00063 /*
00064  * Check whether file has possible unwritten pages.
00065  *
00066  * \retval 1    file is mmap-ed or has dirty pages
00067  *         0    otherwise
00068  */
00069 blkcnt_t dirty_cnt(struct inode *inode)
00070 {
00071         blkcnt_t cnt = 0;
00072         struct vvp_object *vob = cl_inode2vvp(inode);
00073         void              *results[1];
00074 
00075         if (inode->i_mapping != NULL)
00076                 cnt += radix_tree_gang_lookup_tag(&inode->i_mapping->page_tree,
00077                                                   results, 0, 1,
00078                                                   PAGECACHE_TAG_DIRTY);
00079         if (cnt == 0 && atomic_read(&vob->vob_mmap_cnt) > 0)
00080                 cnt = 1;
00081 
00082         return (cnt > 0) ? 1 : 0;
00083 }
00084 
00085 int cl_glimpse_lock(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
00086                     struct inode *inode, struct cl_object *clob, int agl)
00087 {
00088         const struct lu_fid *fid = lu_object_fid(&clob->co_lu);
00089         struct cl_lock *lock = vvp_env_lock(env);
00090         struct cl_lock_descr *descr = &lock->cll_descr;
00091         int result;
00092 
00093         ENTRY;
00094         result = 0;
00095 
00096         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Glimpsing inode "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
00097 
00098         /* NOTE: this looks like DLM lock request, but it may
00099          *       not be one. Due to CEF_ASYNC flag (translated
00100          *       to LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT by osc), this is
00101          *       glimpse request, that won't revoke any
00102          *       conflicting DLM locks held. Instead,
00103          *       ll_glimpse_callback() will be called on each
00104          *       client holding a DLM lock against this file,
00105          *       and resulting size will be returned for each
00106          *       stripe. DLM lock on [0, EOF] is acquired only
00107          *       if there were no conflicting locks. If there
00108          *       were conflicting locks, enqueuing or waiting
00109          *       fails with -ENAVAIL, but valid inode
00110          *       attributes are returned anyway. */
00111         *descr = whole_file;
00112         descr->cld_obj = clob;
00113         descr->cld_mode = CLM_READ;
00114         descr->cld_enq_flags = CEF_ASYNC | CEF_MUST;
00115         if (agl)
00116                 descr->cld_enq_flags |= CEF_AGL;
00117         /*
00118          * CEF_ASYNC is used because glimpse sub-locks cannot
00119          * deadlock (because they never conflict with other
00120          * locks) and, hence, can be enqueued out-of-order.
00121          *
00122          * CEF_MUST protects glimpse lock from conversion into
00123          * a lockless mode.
00124          */
00125         result = cl_lock_request(env, io, lock);
00126         if (result < 0)
00127                 RETURN(result);
00128 
00129         if (!agl) {
00130                 ll_merge_attr(env, inode);
00131                 if (i_size_read(inode) > 0 && inode->i_blocks == 0) {
00132                         /*
00133                          * LU-417: Add dirty pages block count
00134                          * lest i_blocks reports 0, some "cp" or
00135                          * "tar" may think it's a completely
00136                          * sparse file and skip it.
00137                          */
00138                         inode->i_blocks = dirty_cnt(inode);
00139                 }
00140         }
00141 
00142         cl_lock_release(env, lock);
00143 
00144         RETURN(result);
00145 }
00146 
00147 static int cl_io_get(struct inode *inode, struct lu_env **envout,
00148                      struct cl_io **ioout, __u16 *refcheck)
00149 {
00150         struct lu_env           *env;
00151         struct cl_io            *io;
00152         struct ll_inode_info    *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00153         struct cl_object        *clob = lli->lli_clob;
00154         int result;
00155 
00156         if (S_ISREG(inode->i_mode)) {
00157                 env = cl_env_get(refcheck);
00158                 if (!IS_ERR(env)) {
00159                         io = vvp_env_thread_io(env);
00160                         io->ci_obj = clob;
00161                         *envout = env;
00162                         *ioout  = io;
00163                         result = +1;
00164                 } else
00165                         result = PTR_ERR(env);
00166         } else
00167                 result = 0;
00168         return result;
00169 }
00170 
00171 int cl_glimpse_size0(struct inode *inode, int agl)
00172 {
00173         /*
00174          * We don't need ast_flags argument to cl_glimpse_size(), because
00175          * osc_lock_enqueue() takes care of the possible deadlock that said
00176          * argument was introduced to avoid.
00177          */
00178         /*
00179          * XXX but note that ll_file_seek() passes LDLM_FL_BLOCK_NOWAIT to
00180          * cl_glimpse_size(), which doesn't make sense: glimpse locks are not
00181          * blocking anyway.
00182          */
00183         struct lu_env          *env = NULL;
00184         struct cl_io           *io  = NULL;
00185         __u16                   refcheck;
00186         int                     result;
00187 
00188         ENTRY;
00189 
00190         result = cl_io_get(inode, &env, &io, &refcheck);
00191         if (result > 0) {
00192         again:
00193                 io->ci_verify_layout = 1;
00194                 result = cl_io_init(env, io, CIT_MISC, io->ci_obj);
00195                 if (result > 0)
00196                         /*
00197                          * nothing to do for this io. This currently happens
00198                          * when stripe sub-object's are not yet created.
00199                          */
00200                         result = io->ci_result;
00201                 else if (result == 0)
00202                         result = cl_glimpse_lock(env, io, inode, io->ci_obj,
00203                                                  agl);
00204 
00205                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_GLIMPSE_DELAY, 2);
00206                 cl_io_fini(env, io);
00207                 if (unlikely(io->ci_need_restart))
00208                         goto again;
00209                 cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
00210         }
00211         RETURN(result);
00212 }
